titles.title: Korean War Veterans Recognition Act of 2003
Korean War Veterans Recognition Act of 2003
Korean War Veterans Recognition Act of 2003
To amend title 4, United States Code, to add National Korean War Veterans Armistice Day to the list of days on which the flag should especially be displayed.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 108-250.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 141.

action.text: Mr. Sensenbrenner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 292.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 9/17/2003--Passed House without amendment. Korean War Veterans Recognition Act of 2003 - Adds National Korean War Veterans Armistice Day, July 27, to the list of days on which the flag of the United States should be displayed.
